channel.title: [317] Cannot connect to my own server
channel.description:
I'm leeching off of a blank client and I have port forwarded (and verified through canyouseeme.org) and changed the server IP in the client.java but I get the "Error connecting to server" error when trying to connect.
Any suggestions?
Thanks.

item.title: [317] Cannot connect to my own server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure the client is set to localhost if you’re on the same computer as the server.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Cannot connect to my own server

item.title: [317] Cannot connect to my own server
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

If the server is open and is confirmed by canyouseeme.org, then the client is the issue.
Check the IP address and the port in which it is connecting to. Also check if the client is compatible with the source.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] Cannot connect to my own server

item.title: [317] Cannot connect to my own server
item.dc:creator: @Lukeyee Lukeyee
item.description:
@Lukeyee wrote:

Sessy Pk3r:

Make sure your environmental variables are set correctly and the ports you are connecting to are open.

I already stated that the ports are open and verified through canyouseeme.org

I’m using a Mac, environmental variables are obsolete, correct?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Cannot connect to my own server
item.dc:creator: @Lukeyee Lukeyee
item.description:
@Lukeyee wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:550224”]connect via localhost
check your firewall(s)[/quote]

I initially tried connecting via localhost, same issue.

I have opened up my firewall to accept incoming/outgoing connections through Java.

I’m on Mac OSX, by the way (if that helps any).

Read full topic
